answers.answer: You need to have a full eye exam to make sure there are no problems causing your vision issues in the dark.  There are multiple conditions that could compromise your night vision including retinitis pigmentosa and glaucoma among many many others and you need to have an ophthalmologist take a look to make sure all is OK.HV
